Detailed Description

template<typename T, int BITS>
class cds::details::marked_ptr< T, BITS >

Generic marked pointer.

Template parameters:

T data type
BITS - bit mask. These bits is used as bit-field in T*.

For 32-bit platforms, the addresses are aligned by 4-byte boundary. Therefore, the lowest 2 bit of the pointer is zero and may be used as bit-field.

For 64-bit platforms, the addresses have 8-byte alignment and the lowest 3 bits of the pointer may be used as bit-field.

Many lock-free algorithms use this lowest unused bits as a bit-field for storing internal flags and operating with the pointer and its flags atomically.

The documentation for this class was generated from the following file:
